intro: Senecio cobrensis, commonly known as the Cobrensis groundsels, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, yellow flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Senecio cobrensis is often used in rock gardens due to its hardy nature and ornamental value.
